dataset_description.name: Predict Students' Dropout and Academic Success - Synthetic Dataset
dataset_description.description: A dataset created from a higher education institution (acquired from several disjoint databases) related to students enrolled in different undergraduate degrees, such as agronomy, design, education, nursing, journalism, management, social service, and technologies. The dataset includes information known at the time of student enrollment (academic path, demographics, and social-economic factors) and the students' academic performance at the end of the first and second semesters. The data is used to build classification models to predict students' dropout and academic sucess. The problem is formulated as a three category classification task, in which there is a strong imbalance towards one of the classes.

features.name: Gender
features.description: Gender of the students
observations: Females have a slightly higher frequency than males
Most of the Female are Graduate (Target) and Most of Male are Dropout (Target)

features.name: Marital_status
features.description: Marital status of the students (partner status)
observations: Most students are single.
Single have an higher Graduate (Target) frequency than others

features.name: Nationality
features.description: Student's nationality
observations: Almost all the students are Portuguese.

features.name: Age_at_enrollment
features.description: Age of the students at the time of enrollment
observations: The Dropout (Target) frequency increase as the Age at Enrollment increase

features.name: Debtor
features.description: Student with financial debts
observations: Most students do not have financial debts.

features.name: Scholarship_holder
features.description: Student recipients of a scholarship
observations: Most students do not receive a scholarship.

features.name: Tuition_fees_up_to_date
features.description: Student with tuition fees up to date
observations: Most students are up to date with tuition fee payments.

features.name: Mothers_qualification
features.description: Mother's educational qualification
observations: The most frequent qualifications are basic/secondary education levels.

features.name: Fathers_qualification
features.description: Father's educational qualification
observations: The most frequent qualifications are basic/secondary education levels.

features.name: Mothers_occupation
features.description: Mother's employment status
observations: The category Unskilled Workers is predominant, while the others are balanced with each other.

features.name: Fathers_occupation
features.description: Father's employment status
observations: The category Unskilled Workers is predominant, while the others are balanced with each other.

features.name: Displaced
features.description: Student living away from home
observations: The two categories are fairly balanced.

features.name: Attendance
features.description: Mode of class attendance of the student
observations: Most students attend in Daytime mode.

features.name: Educational_special_needs
features.description: Student with special educational needs
observations: Most students do not have special educational needs.

features.name: International
features.description: Student enrolled in an international mobility program
observations: Most students are not involved in international mobility.

features.name: Application_mode
features.description: Enrollment method
observations: Most students enroll through the General Contingent mode.

features.name: Application_order
features.description: Preference expressed at enrollment
observations: The frequency decreases as the priority decreases (1st Choice = highest frequency, 5th Choice = lowest frequency).

features.name: Previous_qualification
features.description: Previous qualification of the student
observations: Most students have a Secondary Education.

features.name: Course
features.description: Course attended by the student
observations: The categories are quite balanced.

features.name: Previous_qualification_(grade)
features.description: Final grade of the previous qualification
observations: Previous_qualification_(grade) has a moderate positive correlation with Admission_grade

features.name: Admission_grade
features.description: Admission grade to the course
observations: Admission_grade has a moderate positive correlation with Previous_qualification_(grade)

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(credited)
features.description: Validated Curricular Units in the first semester
observations: Most students have 0 Curricular Units Credited

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(credited)
features.description: Validated Curricular Units in the second semester
observations: Most students have 0 Curricular Units Credited

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(enrolled)
features.description: Curricular Units attended in the first semester
observations: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(enrolled) have a positive correlation With Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(enrolled)

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(enrolled)
features.description: Curricular Units attended in the second semester
observations: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(enrolled) have a positive correlation With Curricular_units_1st_sem_(enrolled)

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(evaluations)
features.description: Number of assessments received (attempts made) for the curricular units in the first semester
observations: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(evaluations) have a positive correlation With Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(evaluations)

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(evaluations)
features.description: Number of assessments received (attempts made) for the curricular units in the second semester
observations: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(evaluations) have a positive correlation With Curricular_units_1st_sem_(evaluations)

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(approved)
features.description: Completed Curricular Units (exam passed) in the first semester
observations: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(approved) have a strong positive correlation With Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(approved)

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(approved)
features.description: Completed Curricular Units (exam passed) in the second semester
observations: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(approved) have a strong positive correlation With Curricular_units_1st_sem_(approved)

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(grade)
features.description: Average grade of the curricular units in the first semester
observations: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(grade) have a positive correlation With Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(grade)
Students with an higher Curricular_units_1st_sem_(grade) have an higher Graduate (Target) Frequency Rate

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(grade)
features.description: Average grade of the curricular units in the second semester
observations: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(grade) have a strong positive correlation With Curricular_units_1st_sem_(grade)
Students with an higher Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(grade) have an higher Graduate (Target) Frequency Rate

features.name: Curricular_units_1st_sem_(without_evaluations)
features.description: Curricular Units without evaluations in the first semester
observations: Most students have 0 Curricular Units Without Evaluations.

features.name: Curricular_units_2nd_sem_(without_evaluations)
features.description: Curricular Units without evaulations in the second semester
observations: Most students have 0 Curricular Units Without Evaluations.

features.name: GDP
features.description: Percentage change in GDP of Portugal in the year of enrollment
observations: GDP have a moderate negative correlation With Unemployment_rate

features.name: Inflation_rate
features.description: Inflation rate of Portugal in the year of enrollment

features.name: Unemployment_rate
features.description: Unemployment rate of Portugal in the year of enrollment
observations: Unemployment_rate have a moderate negative correlation with GDP

features.name: Target
features.description: Student outcome at the end of the academic course duration (Target)
observations: Graduate has the highest frequency followed by Dropout and Enrolled
